member.name: AR_STATE
member.summary: Indicates the state of screen auto-rotation for the system. For example, whether auto-rotation is supported, and whether it is enabled by the user. This enum is a bitwise OR of one or more of the following values.

summary.code: Auto-rotation is enabled by the user.

member.name: AR_STATE.AR_DISABLED
member.summary: Auto-rotation is disabled by the user.

member.name: AR_STATE.AR_SUPPRESSED
member.summary: Auto-rotation is currently suppressed by one or more process auto-rotation preferences.

member.name: AR_STATE.AR_REMOTESESSION
member.summary: The session is remote, and auto-rotation is temporarily disabled as a result.

member.name: AR_STATE.AR_MULTIMON
member.summary: The system has multiple monitors attached, and auto-rotation is temporarily disabled as a result.

member.name: AR_STATE.AR_NOSENSOR
member.summary: The system does not have an auto-rotation sensor.

member.name: AR_STATE.AR_NOT_SUPPORTED
member.summary: Auto-rotation is not supported with the current system configuration.

member.name: AR_STATE.AR_DOCKED
member.summary: The device is docked, and auto-rotation is temporarily disabled as a result.

member.name: AR_STATE.AR_LAPTOP
member.summary: The device is in laptop mode, and auto-rotation is temporarily disabled as a result.
